name: Patricia Vargas
title: Associate Professor / Founding Director of the Robotics Laboratory

name: Maria Chiara Carozza
title: Professor
organization: Biorobotics, Sant'Anna School of Advanced Studies (SSSUP)

name: Catherine Mohr
title: President
bio: Catherine Mohr is President of the Intuitive Foundation and previously the Vice President of Strategy for Intuitive Surgical. Mohr has a diverse background holding a B.S. and M.S. in Mech Eng from MIT and an M.D. from Stanford University.

name: Ecem Tuğlan
title: Co-Founder Fenom Robotics
bio: Ecem Tuğlan is a CoFounder of Fenom Robotics a company that builds the World’s First Hologram Displaying Robot. Tuğlan is a NASA-approved robopsychologist. Her studies focus on optimizing the human-robot interaction.

name: Aude Billard
title: Full Professor | Director of the Learning Algorithms and Systems Laboratory
organization: EPFL École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne

name: Margaret Boden
title: Research Professor of Cognitive Science
bio: Boden created the world's first program in cognitive science and is a Fellow of the British Academy, and the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence. She explains that 'robots won't take over, because they couldn't care less'.

name: K.G. Engelhart
title: Science Dept Head at Stanislaus Union
organization: Founder and Director of the Center for Human Service Robotics at CMU (1989)
bio: Pioneering roboticist, researcher and educator, Engelhardt's career spans Stanford, NASA and CMU in the 70s, 80s and 90s. Leaving robotics research for family reasons in the 2000s, her passion for STEM is still clear. Her bio is inspirational!

name: Elizabeth Jochum
title: Associate Professor, Head of Research Laboratory for Art and Technology
bio: Jochum's research combines the fields of art and robotics, and includes ongoing research collaborations across disciplines, within Denmark and internationally. She explores the impact of robotics and automation on scientists and citizens.

name: Philippa Glover
title: Managing Director
bio: Glover is passionate about addressing the challenges and opportunities of robotics and automation. She sits on several advisory boards including MAKE UK Regional, and Industrial Strategy Challenge fund Manufacturing Made Smarter.

name: Nancy Sun
title: Head of Systems and Safety
bio: Nancy Sun is Head of Systems & Safety at Nuro, a startup bringing zero emissions autonomous delivery to communities. Previously, CoFounder & Chief Engineer at Ike (acquired by Nuro). Sun has deep expertise in systems engineering and transportation.

name: Samia Nefti-Meziani
title: Founder and Head, Professor
organization: Salford University,University of Salford's Autonomous Systems and Advances Robotics Research Centre

name: Allison Okamura
title: Associate Professor | Director of the CHARM Lab ... Professor

name: Beste Ozcan
title: Founder of Transitional Wearable Companions concept and +me
organization: Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Intitute of Cognitive Sciences and Technologies, National Research Council of Italy
bio: Ozcan is the founder of “Transitional Wearable Companions” concept, like award winning Lokahi and +me wearable companion for children with autism. She combines materials, shapes, colors and interactions for social robotics in unique ways.

name: Ming Lin
title: Professor Dr. Barry Mersky and Capital One Endowed Professor; Distinguished University Professor
organization: Department of Computer Science, University of Maryland
bio: Ming C. Lin researches real-time physics-based interaction and simulation for virtual environments, robotics and haptics. She has received many awards and patents for her work and is active in the IEEE, ACM and CRA-W communities.

name: Cristina Olaverri Monreal
title: BMVIT Endowed Professorship and Chair for Sustainable Transport Logistics 4.0

name: Andrea Thomaz
title: Associate Professor of Interactive Computing | Driector of the Socially Intelligent Machines Lab .... Cofounder of Diligent Robotics | Associate Professor at University of Texas Austin
organization: Georgia Tech ..DIligent Robotics | University of Texas Austin

name: Kay Firth-Butterfield
title: Project Head / Executive Committee Vice-Chair / CoFounder
organization: AI and Machine Learning at World Economic Forum / IEEE Global Initiative for Ethical Considerations in AI and Autonomous Systems / AI Austin

name: Shelly Levy-Tzedek
title: Associate Professor and Director of the Cognition, Aging & Rehabilitation Laboratory
bio: Levy-Tzedek's lab studies the effects of age and disease (in particular, Parkinson's disease & stroke) on the control of body movement, and how to best employ robotics to facilitate a fast and efficient rehabilitation process.

name: Rebecca Kramer-Bottiglio
title: John J. Lee Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering & Materials Science
bio: Rebecca Kramer-Bottiglio leads the Faboratory at Yale University, exploring shape-shifting and adaptive soft robots. Her lab is developing new multi-functional materials, soft sensors and actuators, to reduce the complexity of responsive systems.

name: Rita Cucchiara
title: Full Professor / Head of AImageLab
organization: University of Modena and Reggio Emilia

name: Kristen Facciol
title: Operations Engineer, Robotics Flight Controller
bio: An aerospace engineer from the University of Toronto, Facciol worked on the Next Generation Canadarm project and now supports robotics operations on the International Space Station (ISS) as well as training astronauts.

name: Ruzena Bajcsy
title: Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences | Director ...NEC Chair and Professor, Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science | Founder
organization: Berkeley | CITRIS The Center for Information Technology Research in the Interest of Society ...University of California, Berkeley | HART

name: Daniela Rus
title: Director of CSAIL | Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science | Director of the Distributed Robotics Laboratory ...Deputy Dean of Research, Schwarzman College of Computing

name: Deanna Hood
title: Senior Robotics Engineer
bio: Deanna Hood is the Australian Young Engineer of the Year 2022 and an award winning engineering communicator. Most recently, she's been senior robotics engineer at Inventia Life Science for a pioneering skin printing robot for burn victims.

name: Elnaz Sarraf
title: Founder & CEO
bio: Sarraf is the CEO of an educational robot company named one of TIME Magazine’s Best Inventions and most recently the winner of the 2021 WEF Smart Toy Awards. She is an experienced marketer and entrepreneur.

name: Antonia Tzemanaki
title: Assistant Professor in Robotics
bio: Tzemanaki's research focusses on robot hands, hand exoskeletons, kinematics, wearable technologies, haptics and bio-inspired robotics. She is also the organiser of the Bristol Women in Robotics group @WirBristol on Twitter.

name: Stefana Parascho
title: Assistant Professor
bio: She is an architect with a focus on computational design and innovative robotic fabrication. Parascho's work has been exhibited at international venues, such as the Milan Design Week and the Academy of Arts.

name: Sophia Williams
title: Sr. Software and Controls Engineer, Research and Innovation
bio: Sophia Williams is a Senior Software and Controls Engineer at Auris Health, Inc. She is a recent graduate of Standford, where she earned her Ph.D. in Electronics and Electrical Engineering. Williams is also a chapter leader for Black in Robotics.

name: Laurel Riek
title: Associate Professor of Computer Science and Engineering & Director
organization: Healthcare Robotics Lab, University of California San Diego
bio: She serves on the editorial boards of ACM Transactions on Human Robot Interaction, IEEE Transactions on Robotics, and was the 2020 HRI Technical Program Committee Co-Chair.
wikipedia: Dr. Laurel Riek is an Associate Professor in Computer Science and Engineering at the University of California, San Diego, with joint appointments in the Department of Emergency Medicine and Contextual Robotics Institute. Dr. Riek directs the Healthcare Robotics Lab, and leads research in human-robot teaming and health informatics, and builds intelligent systems which work proximately with people. Riek’s current research projects have applications in acute care, neurorehabilitation, and community health, and focus on fostering inclusion and health equity.  Dr. Riek received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Cambridge, and B.S. in Logic and Computation from Carnegie Mellon. Riek served as a Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer and Roboticist at The MITRE Corporation from 2000-2008, working on learning and vision systems for robots, and held the Clare Boothe Luce chair in Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Notre Dame from 2011-2016. Dr. Riek has received the NSF CAREER Award, AFOSR Young Investigator Award, Qualcomm Research Award, and multiple best paper awards.

name: Sarah Spurgeon OBE
title: Professor of Control Engineering, Head of Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering
bio: Senior IEEE Fellow and awarded an OBE, Spurgeon works to optimize different systems, including planes, cars, robots and healthcare. Spurgeon's sliding mode control theory overcomes the discrepancies between the plant and model used for control design.

name: Avye Couloute
title: Gen Arm 2Z Ambassador/ Founder of Girls into Coding
organization: Gen Arm 2Z Ambassador, Girls Into Coding

name: Angela Schoellig
title: Professor
organization: University of Toronto, UTIAS (Dynamic System Lab)

name: Michelle J. Johnson
title: Associate Professor & Director of Rehabilitation Robotics Lab

name: Lea Rosen
title: Attorney | Director of Research
organization: DARC Drones and Aerial Robotics Conference

name: Elizabeth Sklar
title: Research Director and Professor
organization: Agrirobotics and University of Lincoln and Kings College of London

name: Birgit Vogel-Heuser
title: Computer Scientist & Chair Professor of Automation and Information Systems
bio: Distinguished Lecturer of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society, Advisory Board Member of VDI/VDE-GMA, Vogel-Heuser, holds Dipl. Ing. degrees in electrical and mechanical engineering. She researches the modeling of distributed and embedded systems.

name: Electrical Engineering Department College of Engineering Trivandrum
title: Professor and Dean of Student Affairs
bio: The Electrical Engineering Dept at College of Engineering Trivandrum has many excellent women students, professors, inventors and roboticists, including VR Jisha who leads the Kerala IEEE RAS Chapter and is Dean of Student Affairs.

name: Xiaoou Li
title: Investigadora
organization: CINVESTAV-IPN ? National Polytechnic Institute of Mexico
bio: Xiaoou Li is a professor of computer science at CINVESTAV-IPN Mexico, the National Polytechnic, and General Chair of the recent IEEE RAS CASE 2022 conference. She focuses on AI, machine learning and data science for industrial automation.

name: Julie Shah
title: Boeing Assistant Professor of Aeronautics and Astronautics | Lead of the Interactive Robotics Group

name: Elizabeth Broadbent
title: Professor of Health Psychology
bio: Broadbent's work at the intersection of psychology and robotics looks at hazards deriving from low levels of perception of safety which can be caused by robot appearance, behaviour, and affective capabilities.

name: Jamie Paik
title: Professor at EPFL, Director and Founder of Reconfigurable Robotics Lab

name: Louise Poubel
title: Software Engineer at Open Source Robotics Foundation

name: Manuela Veloso
title: Herbert A. Simon Professor in Computer Science

name: Wendy Ju
title: Executive Director and Associate Professor of Interaction Design
organization: Center for Design Research at Stanford University and California College of the Arts

name: Allison Thackston
title: Staff Software Engineer at Waymo, Manager Shared Autonomy

name: Aisha Walcott-Bryant
title: Senior Staff Research Scientist
bio: Aisha Walcott-Bryant is a Senior Staff Research Scientist at Google. She earned her Ph.D. in Electrical Eng. and Computer Science at MIT and has a strong interest in developing AI tools for Global Health. Aisha is the program co-chair for ICRA'22.

name: Shivani Torres
title: Co-Founder, Chief Product & Service Officer
bio: Firestarter, architect of impact and investor, Torres helped build thousands of products at the Stanford Product Realization Lab, before joining Lemnos VC, and now Palumni VC. In her 'spare' time she builds giant flaming artworks.

name: Goldie Nejat
title: Professor and Canada Research Chair in Robots for Society
bio: Goldie Nejat is the Canada Research Chair in Robots for Society, a Full Professor at the U of Toronto, and an Adjunct Scientist at the Toronto Rehabilitation Inst. She is the Founder and Director of the Autonomous Systems and Biomechatronics Lab.

name: Mikell Taylor
title: Principal Technical Program Manager
bio: Mikell Taylor is Principal Technical Program Manager at Amazon Robotics, where she leads the Autonomous Mobility technology and product development program. In 2018 Taylor was recognized as a top woman in the Boston tech community by Accomplice VC.

name: Robin Murphy
title: Raytheon Professor of Computer Science and Engineering |  Director of the Center for Robot-Assisted Search and Rescue

name: Claire Tomlin
title: Charles A. Desoer Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences

name: Kerstin Vignard
title: Deputy to the Director, Chief of Operations
bio: With over 25 years’ experience at the UN, Vignard leads UNIDIR’s work to develop policy frameworks on the weaponization of increasingly autonomous technologies, enabling policy makers to make better informed decisions about killer robots.

name: Mollie Claypool
title: Co-Founder and CEO of Automated Architecture
organization: Co-Director of AUAR Labs at UCL
bio: Mollie Claypool is CoFounder and CEO of Automated Architecture, building a distributed manufacturing network for regenerative net-zero timber housing using advanced robotics. She also cowrote Robotic Building: Architecture in the Age of Automation.

name: Timnit Gebru
title: Co-Founder of Black in AI
bio: Gebru is a researcher and activist in artificial intelligence, working to reduce the potential negative impacts of AI. Prior to her PhD, she worked at Apple designing circuits and signal processing algorithms products including the first iPad.

name: Maartje De Graaf
title: Postdoctoral Research Associate
organization: Cognitive, Linguistic and Psychological Sciences, Brown University

name: Lynne Parker
title: Professor and Associate Head in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science |Director Distributed Intelligence Laboratory .... Deputy Chief Technology Officer of the United States

title: Professor at the Institute of Computer Engineering (ZITI)

name: Raquel Urtasun

organization: University of Toronto & Head of Uber ATG, Co-Founder of Vector Institute for AI

title: Postdoctoral research fellow at ACIN Institute of Automation and Control at Vienna University of Technology (Austria)

name: Veronica Santos
title: Assoc. Prof. of UCLA Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering / Principal Investigator
organization: Director of the UCLA Biomechatronics Laboratory

name: Margarita Chli
title: SNF Assistant Professor at ETHZ, Honorary Fellow of the University of Edinburgh

title: Assistant Professor / Guest Researcher
organization: Stanford / Autonomous Motion Department, Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems

name: Rong Xiong
title: Professor at Zhejiang University

title: Assoc Professor | CoDirector Centre for Social Robotics | Director of CRL
organization: Australian Center for Field Robotics University of Sydney | NIEA

name: Catherine Ball
title: Founder & CEO, Remote Research Ranges / Managing Director, Elemental Strategy

name: Maria Piechnick
title: CoFounder
bio: Maria Piechnick is an innovator and CoFounder of Wandelbots, a Dresden startup that is revolutionizing industrial robotics. She was recently appointed as a core member of the advisory board "Young Digital Economy" at the BMWK.

name: Rosalie Wang
title: Assistant Professor
organization: Intelligent and Assistive Technology and Systems Lab, University of Toronto / Toronto Rehabilitative Institute

name: Angela Maio
title: Mechanical Engineer at the U.S. Army DEVCOM Army Research Lab
organization: Virtual Competition Lead for the DARPA SubT Challenge
bio: Angela Maio is a Mech Engineer at the U.S. Army DEVCOM Army Research Lab. She earned her MS in Mech Eng from the University of Colorado, and was Virtual Competition Lead for the DARPA SubT Challenge, advancing underground robotic exploration.

name: Elizabeth Croft
title: Professor | Director of the Collaborative Advanced Robotics and Intelligent Systems Laboratory....Dean, Faculty of Engineering
organization: University of British Columbia ... Monash University

name: Serena Ivaldi
title: Tenured Research Scientist
bio: Ivaldi leads the humanoid and human-robot interaction activities of the Team Larsen in INRIA. She has been developing whole-body tele-operation for the iCub humanoid robot and pioneered the use of exoskeletons in the ICU to assist physicians.

name: Sophie Lantermann
title: Head of Robotics Products
bio: Sophie Lantermann is Head of Robotic Products for Franka Emika, a fast growing and award winning company with a force sensitive robot platform. She studied M.Eng at Cambridge and TUM before working at DLR, and MAN Truck & Bus.

name: Hui Li
title: Principal Research Scientist
bio: Li's main research area is the intersection of machine learning and robotics for manufacturing and construction automation applications, building on her previous roles leading robotics research at Airware, Boeing and CSAIL.

name: Katia Sycara
title: Research Professor, Director of Advanced Agent-Robotics Technology Lab
organization: Carnegie Mellon University / University of Aberdeen

name: Karon Maclean
title: Professor
organization: UBC, Canadian - on Research Women list on github, Director, SPIN The Sensory Perception and Interaction Research Group

name: Pauline Pounds
title: Associate Professor
organization: School of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering, University of Queensland
bio: Pauline Pounds is an Assoc. Professor at the University of Queensland with a wealth of experience in the mechatronics field, on topics including aerial drones, innovative sensors, and stability control. She earned her PhD in Robotics at ANU in 2008.

name: Afghan Girls Robotics Team
title: Afghan Dreamers
bio: On escaping Afghanistan, Somaya Faruqi told NBC News “When I fix something, I feel free - I feel powerful.” Afghan Dreamers, a film following the original team comes out soon, showcasing the girls' strength, curiosity and courage.

name: Cyra Richardson
title: Chief Product Officer / Chief Technology Officer
bio: Attabotics automates supply chains for global commerce, inspired by the efficiency and structure of ant colonies. Richardson leads their product strategy and development, commercialization and technical strategy.

name: Maren Bennewitz
title: Junior professor in of Computer Science | Head of Humanoid Robots Lab... Professor for humanoid robots at the University of Bonn

name: Carme Torras
title: Research Professor & Science Fiction Author
bio: Torras is an IEEE Fellow, recipient of the Julio Peláez Award to Pioneer Women in Science and also a writer whose short stories and novels often address ethical dilemmas raised by robotics, AI and social media.

name: Fatemeh Pahlevan Aghababa
title: Software engineer Lead at Farakav co. | Technical Committee Head of International Robocup Federation| CTO at Ribona

name: Alisa Koniukhovskaia
title: CEO
bio: Koniukhovskaia is the representative of Russia in the International Federation of Robotics. She organizes statistical data collection on the Russian robotics industry and develops international cooperation and government relations.

name: Kerstin Dautenhahn
title: Professor Computer Science | Director Adaptive Systems Research Group.... Professor and Canada 150 Research Chair in Intelligent Robotics
organization: University of Hertfordshire ...University of Waterloo and University of Hertfordshire

name: Cordelia Schmid
title: Research Director at INRIA
bio: Cordelia Schmid is Research Director at INRIA. Since 2018 she holds a joint appointment with Google research. She is a fellow of the IEEE. Schmid is recognized as one of the world's leading specialists in computer-aided vision.

name: Nuzha Yakoob
title: Head of Technology & Innovation / MIET & MIEEE
bio: Nuzha Yakoob, Head of Tech & Innovation at Festo, is among the industry’s leaders in developing new robotics and automation applications. Highly experienced, Yakoob was featured in SME's '21 list of women making their mark in robotics and automation.

name: Chieko Asakawa
title: IBM Distinguished Service Professor
bio: Chieko Asakawa is an IBM Fellow at CMU who has pioneered accessible technology for the visually impaired. Winner of many awards in US and Japan, she is also the Chief Executive Director of Japanese National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation.

name: Ellen Purdy
title: Director, Emerging Capabilities & Prototyping Initiatives & Analysis
organization: Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense

name: Silvia Ferrari
title: Professor of Mechanical Engineering and Materials Science | Director
organization: Duke University | Laboratory for Intelligent Systems and Controls & WISeNet

name: Joanne Pransky
title: World's First Robotic Psychiatrist®
bio: Joanne Pransky, the World's First Robotic Psychiatrist, is an American robotics enthusiast and futurist who provides professional advice on the use and marketing of robotics devices. Pransky is a pioneer, in studying the personal robotic evolution.

name: Hannah Joshua
title: Science Communicator
bio: Joshua is a physicist and science communicator who can usually be found buried under piles of components, assembling charmingly overcomplicated solutions to everyday problems with a little open source hardware, a few wires and a lot of enthusiasm.

name: Samantha Payne
title: COO of Open Bionics; shortlisted for Entrepreneur of the Year

name: Jessica Burgner-Kahrs
title: Professor and Associate Director
bio: Burgner-Kahrs is an award winning researcher focusing on continuum robotics and in particular on design, modeling, planning and control, as well as human-robot interaction. She was selected as one of 100 Global Young Leaders by WEF.

name: Heather Knight
title: Doctoral research | Marilyn Monrobot ... Assistant Professor

name: Nadine Bender Reisner
title: Senior Analyst Social impact of Robotics
bio: Bender Reisner focuses on HRC in industrial manufacturing processes as well as collaboration and cooperation in care and rehab scenarios. She studies the ethical, legal and psycho-social impact robotics and AI have on humans.

name: Maitreyee Wairagkar
title: Postdoctoral Scholar - Neuroengineering and BCI
bio: Maitreyee Wairagkar is a biomedical scientist developing advanced neurotechnology using artificial intelligence. Wairagkar is a Postdoctoral Researcher at UC Davis and BrainGate Consortium. She has a passion for developing life-enabling technologies.

name: Yael Edan
title: Professor, Head of ABC Robotics Lab
organization: Ben-Gurion University of the Negev (BGU), ABC Robotics Lab

name: Concha Monje
title: Investigadora del Robotics Lab
bio: Concha Monje is a Full Professor at Carlos III University of Madrid. She earned her PhD in Industrial Eng. from the University of Extremadura (2006) with distinction and awards. She is a frequent guest speaker and experienced scientific reviewer.

name: Kerstin Haring
title: Assistant Professor of Computer Science
organization: Director of the Humane Robot Technology Lab at University of Denver
bio: An award winning researcher who's career spans Japan, Germany and USA, Haring plans to research robot-human interactions, human-technology interactions, and ethics in robotics, utilizing the entertainment factor of robots.

name: Wendy Keski-Keturi
title: Vice President and Partner of Hermia Business Development
organization: Director of Investment, International Alliance of Robotics Associations
bio: Keski-Keturi brings her international commercialization skills to developing a global robotics investment program at IARA bringing more international cooperation among companies in robotics for better innovation, market entry and better society.

name: Marie-Christine Caron
title: Director of Operations
bio: Marie-Christine Caron is Senior Operations Manager at GE Bromont and was featured in SME's 2020 list of women making their mark in robotics and automation. Her knowledge of manufacturing systems helps GE Aviation adopt the latest technologies.

name: Mariela Cerrada Lozada
title: Professor
bio: Mariela Cerrada Lozada combines AI, data science, ML, and control systems expertise to improve industrial manufacturing. She is based at Universidad Politécnica Salesiana, Ecuador. and has a top 2% science impact ranking.

name: Leslie Kaelbling
title: Panasonic Professor of Computer Science and Engineering

name: Karen Hao
title: Tech Reporter
bio: Karen Hao is an award winning HK-based reporter at the Wall St Journal, previously senior editor at MIT Technology Review. She has a M.Eng degree from MIT, worked at an Alphabet spinout and now writes about the impact of cutting edge-AI and robotics.

name: Keiko Homma
title: Senior Researcher
organization: Service Robotics Research Team, Robot Innovation Research Center, AIST

name: Yukie Nagai
title: Project Professor and Director of Cognitive Developmental Robotics Lab

name: Kate Devitt
title: Chief Scientist at Trusted Autonomous Systems, CEO of Better Beliefs
organization: Adjunct Associate Professor in Human-Computer Interaction, ITEE, University of Queensland
bio: Researcher and author with a very interdisciplinary background, Devitt builds technologies that enable the development of autonomous systems that incorporate ethical, legal, and regulatory structures for trusted adoption.

name: Marcela Riccillo
title: Specialist in Artificial Intelligence & Robotics - Professor Machine Learning & Data Science

name: Ayanna Howard
title: Motorola Foundation Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering | Director ... Professor and Chair of School of Interactive Computing |  Director of the Human-Automation Systems Lab (HumAnS)

name: Vanessa Evers
title: Professor of Computer Science
organization: University of Twente Human Media Interaction Group

name: Aimee van Wynsberghe
title: CoFounder of Foundation for Responsible Robotics, Assistant Professor

name: Cynthia Breazeal
title: Associate Professor of Media Arts and Sciences |  Director of the Personal Robots Group .... Professor of Media Arts and Sciences |  Director of the Personal Robots Group | Founder & Chief Scientist

name: Rediet Adebe
title: Director of Black in AI and Assistant Professor of Computer Science
organization: Mechanisms for Social Good  |  University of California, Berkeley
bio: Abebe researches algorithms and artificial intelligence, with a focus on inequality and distributed justice concerns. She is passionate about addressing real-world problems in the roll out of technology and increasingly autonomous systems.

name: Praminda Caleb-Solly
title: Professor of Embodied Intelligence
organization: School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham and Bristol Robotics Laboratory
bio: Caleb-Solly is also Co-Founder and Director of Robotics for Good, a social purpose startup bringing robots into everyday life to empower people, and she advises standards committees on Service Robot Safety and Ethics.

name: Jeanne Dietsch
title: Executive Director
bio: Jeanne Dietsch cofounded Mobile Robotics in 1995 and was CEO until the company was sold to Adept Technology in 2010, where she was VP of Emerging Technology. She is proud of the impact her world leading affordable autonomous mobile robots have had.

name: Roberta Nelson Shea
title: Global Technical Compliance Officer
bio: Roberta Nelson Shea is the Global Technical Compliance Officer at Universal Robots, with over 40 years of experience in safety and standardization for automation. She was recognized by SME as an Exceptional Woman in Robotics and Automation.

name: Mercedes Soria
title: EVP of Software Engineering, Chief Intelligence Officer
bio: Winner of Anita Borg's ABIE Award for Leadership in 2017, Mentor for the US TechWomen Program and in the U.S. Speaker Program, Soria initially didn't speak English when she emigrated from Ecuador. She excels in both business and computer science.

name: Kathy Colabaugh
title: Society Operations Manager
bio: Kathy Colabaugh has been a Senior Administrator at IEEE since 2000, Program Specialist since 2005 and Society Operations Manager for the Robotics and Automation Society since 2011. She made everything work (and we wish her happy retirement!)

name: Hazlina Selamat
title: Associate Professor at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Director at Apt Touch Sdn Bhd and Research Fellow at  Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics (CAIRO)
organization: Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Apt Touch Sdn Bhd  and Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics (CAIRO

name: Alicia Casals
title: Full Professor in the Automatic Control and Computer Engineering Dept | Leader of the Robotics Group at IBEC ....  Professor of the department of Automatic Control, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPS).
organization: Technical University of Catalonia ....Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPS).

name: Jessica Hodgins
title: Professor / Research Mgr and Operations Lead FAIR

name: Agnieszka Wykowska
title: Senior Researcher Tenured - Principal Investigator
bio: Agnieszka Wykowska, a cognitive neuroscientist, is the Principal Investigator of the Human-Robot Interaction research line at the Italian Institute of Technology. Wykowska is an Editor-in-Chief of the International Journal of Social Robotics.

name: Maria Gini
title: Morse-Alumni Distinguished Teaching Professor of Computer Science

name: Gentiane Venture
title: Distinguished Professor & Director of the GVLab
organization: Tokyo University of Agriculture and Technology
bio: A French roboticist in Japan, Venture's main research interests include dynamics modeling and identification, robot control, human-robot interactions, and interdisciplinary research redefining the boundaries of robotics.

name: Dejanira Araiza-Illan
title: Assistant Principal Engineer in Robotic Applications at Johnson & Johnson
organization: Visiting Fellow in Computer Science at University of Bristol
bio: Araiza-Illan develops robotics for industrial manufacturing applications, using a wide range of sensors and integrated industrial equipment. She is CoChair of the IEEE RAS Technical Committee for Verification of Autonomous Systems.

name: Kristen Thomasen
title: Assistant Professor in Law, Robotics and Society
organization: Faculty of Law, University of Windsor
bio: Kristen Thomasen is one of the leading Canadian experts in robotics law and policy, specializing in drone regulation and the privacy impacts of robotic tech. She is an Assistant Professor in Law, Robotics, and Society at the University of Windsor.

name: Raia Hadsell
title: Research Scientist
bio: CORL General Chair

name: Vanessa Sanchez
title: Materials Science & Engineering PhD Candidate
bio: Sanchez focuses on developing robotic fabrics for patients who are ill or disabled. She has created robotic fabric leg sleeves that treat deep-vein thrombosis, as well as soft robotic fabrics with built-in feedback control to assist mobility.

name: Angelica Lim
title: Making Pepper Sociable / Software Engineering Manager

name: Neha Chaudhry
title: Founder
organization: Walk to Beat / Bristol Robotics Lab Incubator

name: Elena Messina
title: Group Leader, Manipulation & Mobility
organization: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

name: Holly A. Yanco
title: Professor of Computer Science | Director
organization: U Mass Lowell | New England Robotics Validation and Experimentation (NERVE) Center

name: Simone Giertz
title: Inventor and DIY Astronaut aka "Queen of Shitty Robots"

name: Maira Saboia Da Silva
title: Postdoctoral Researcher
bio: Maira Saboia Da Silva is a Postdoc Researcher at NASA Jet Propulsion Lab. She completed her Ph.D. in Computer Science and Eng. at the University at Buffalo. Da Silva was selected as a Finalist for the Best Systems Paper Award at the RSS in 2018.

name: Yulia Sandamirskaya
title: Applications Research Lead, Neuromorphic Computing Lab

name: Yuyan Wang
title: Researcher
bio: Yuyan Wang, a researcher at Sichuan University is one of the lead authors on a study of robo-fish that are able to remove microplastics from seas. An incredible robotics development, as we face the critical environmental harm of microplastics.

name: Claire Delaunay
title: VP Engineering
bio: With years of experience leading robotics and autonomous vehicles teams ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies like Uber and Google, Delaunay is responsible for the Isaac robotics initiative at NVIDIA.

name: Lola Cañamero
title: Chair of Robotics and Neuroscience
organization: ETIS Laboratory at CY Cergy Paris University
bio: Cañamero is a pioneer in the field of emotion modeling, using robots to investigate the interactions between motivation, emotion and embodied cognition and action from the perspectives of adaptation, development and evolution.

name: Cindy Bethel
title: Professor and Billie J. Ball Endowed Professorship in Engineering

name: Niamh Donnelly
title: Co-Founder and Director of AI
bio: From Stevie, a socially assistive robot for patient assistance, to germ killing Violet, Donnelly is developing robots with the AI capabilities to safely navigate and appropriately interact with people in healthcare environments.

name: Jing Xiao
title: Professor
organization: University of North Carolina, ICRA 2015, IROS 2015

name: Ana-Maria Stancu
title: CEO of Bucharest Robots
bio: Ana-Maria Stancu is CEO of Bucharest Robots the first Romanian start-up for humanoid and service robots in Romania. She utilizes extensive NGO and robotics expertise as a Board Member of euRobotics aisbl and a Natl Coordinator at Saptamana Roboticii.

name: Aubrey Donnellan
title: Founder
bio: Aubrey Donnellan is CoFounder and COO of Bear Flag Robotics, building autonomous technology for farm tractors. She is an engineer with a business degree and is passionate about making food production more affordable and sustainable.

name: Hagar Marzouk
title: Leader of "Walross" team in MENA
organization: First female leader (Hagar Marzouk of a team in ROV 2014, an Egyptian underwater competition; took the team to first place in Minesweepers 2014, both at the national and international competitions.

name: Inna Sharf
title: Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering | Cofounder of Aerospace Mechatronics Lab

name: Leila Takayama
title: Senior Researcher Researcher at Hoku Labs and Associate Professor at UC Santa Cruz
organization: Google X ... UC Santa Cruz  | Hoku labs

name: St̩ephanie Lacour
title: Prof
organization: School of Engineering at the Ecole Polytechnique F̩d̩rale de Lausanne.

name: Tekedra Mawakana
title: Co-CEO at Waymo
bio: Tekedra Mawakana is CoCEO of Waymo, an autonomous driving tech company. She has led global teams across continents at several large companies, and been recognized by Automotive News in 2020 as a Leading Woman in the North American Auto Industry.

name: Pooja Viswanathan
title: Founder, CEO
bio: Pooja Viswanathan is the Founder and CEO of Braze Mobility, a company that created the first blind spot sensor system for wheelchairs. She was a Post Doc Fellow at the University of Toronto where her research focused on Robotics & Assistive Tech.

name: Karinne Ramirez-Amaro
title:
Associate Professor, Division of Systems and Control, Department of
Electrical Engineering
bio: Karinne Ramirez-Amaro is a Docent/Assoc. Professor at Chalmers University of Technology. She completed her Ph.D. at the Technical University of Munich. She received the Laura Bassi award granted by TUM and the Bavarian govt. as a postdoc fellow.

name: Christine Spiten
title: Investment Banking at Fearnley Securities
organization: Co-Founder BlueEye Robotics, CEO and Co-Captain EntrepreneurShipOne
bio: Christine Spiten is a Norwegian sailing champion, Engineer, and CoFounder of Blueye Robotics, also CoCaptain of EntrepreneurShip One. Spiten has been selected as Forbes 30 under 30 most important Tech Founders, among many other recognitions.

name: Catie Cuan
title: Artist in Residence at X, the moonshot factory
organization: PhD Candidate at Stanford University in the CHARM Lab
bio: Cuan is a dancer, choreographer, researcher, and currently a PhD Candidate in Mechanical Engineering studying haptic feedback and interactions with robots - aka dancing with machines - and receiving several prestigious Fellowships.

name: Leshell Hatley
title: Director of STEM Programs
organization: AAUW American Association of University Women
bio: Hatley is passionate computer engineer, educator, and researcher who creates innovative approaches to teaching artificial intelligence, robotics, and culturally relevant computer science/computer engineering education.

name: Sarah Bergbreiter
title: Assistant Professor in Mechanical Engineering| Director of the Micro Robotics Lab  ... Professor in Mechanical Engineering and PI Microrobotics Lab
organization: University of Maryland ...Carnegie Mellon University ( 2018- present)

name: Carlotta Berry
title: Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering

name: Propa Ghosh
title: Medical Director of Robotic Surgical Services
organization: Hunterdon Medical Center, Greater New York City Area

name: Hanna Wallach
title: Senior Researcher / Assistant Professor / Cofounder
organization: Microsoft Research / UMass Amherst / Women in Machine Learning

name: Avideh Zakhor
title: Consultant with Hilti Group
organization: Qualcomm Chair and professor in EECS at U.C. Berkeley
bio: Avideh Zakhor is Qualcomm Chair and professor in EECS at U.C. Berkeley. A pioneering contributor to Google Earth and Street View, Zakhor is a Grand Challenge winner of DOE’s E-ROBOT Challenge for robots to improve building energy efficiency.

name: Elaine Chen
title: Senior Lecturer | Entrepreneur in Residence | Consultant
organization: MIT Sloan School of Management | Martin Trust Center for MIT Entrepreneurship | Concept Springs

name: Simone Schuerle
title: Branco Weiss Fellow
organization: Koch Institute of Integrative Cancer Research, MIT

name: Kris Dorsey
title: MLK Visiting Professor at MIT Tangible Media Group
organization: Assistant Professor of Engineering at Smith College
bio: Dorsey was inspired by origami. Now her research focuses on the fabrication and characterization of microscale sensors and microelectromechanical systems, where she is interested in wearable health care device applications.

name: Kendra Kerrisk
title: Associate Professor of Veterinary Science | Lead Researcher

name: Clara Vu
title: Cofounder and CTO
bio: An experienced robotics startup founder, Vu was formerly Cofounder and Director of Software Development at Harvest Automation Inc, and Senior Software Engineer at iRobot. Clara holds a B.A. in Mathematics from Yale University.

name: Helen Hastie
title: Director of the EPSRC Centre of Doctoral Training in Robotics and Autonomous Systems
organization: Professor of Computer Science and Academic Lead for the National Robotarium
bio: Helen Hastie is the Academic Lead for the new National Robotarium in Edinburgh. She has over 100 publications and has held positions in many scientific committees and advisory boards, and currently PI on the UKRI Trustworthy Autonomous Systems Node.

name: Jie Song
title: Associate Professor
organization: Department Industrial and Management Engineering, Peking University
bio: Jie Song is an Assoc. Professor at Peking University. She has been honored with the Outstanding Young Researcher award by Lvye Pharma, among many faculty awards. Her research is supported by the NSFC. Song is also an Assoc. Editor for IEEE.

name: Kathrine Kuchenbecker
title: Director at Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems / Associate Professor

name: Emily Cross
title: Professor of Social Robotics / Director of SoBA Lab

name: Mihoko Otake
title: Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering | Founding Director NPO Fonobono Research Institute

name: Sarah Hensley
title: MIT EECS Angle Undergraduate Research and Innovation Scholar

name: Jill Burnett
title: Director and CoFounder
bio: Jill Burnett was the Innovation Manager at Bristol Robotics Laboratory helping startups to commercialize. She is now Director and CoFounder of a BRL spinout, WaveDrives, making innovative rotary and linear actuators for devices like the Schunk Hand.

name: Anjali Jaiprakash
title: Advance QLD Research Fellow
organization: Australian Center for Robotic Vision QUT

name: Sonia Chernova
title: Assistant Professor
organization: School of Interactive Computing, Georgia Tech

name: Estela Bicho
title: Full Professor of Industrial Electronics
bio: Bicho researches the use of dynamic systems for the design and implementation of neuro-cognitive control architectures for robot systems, including HRI & collaboration. She has been PI for national and EU funded research robotics projects.

name: Arianna Menciassi
title: Associate Professor of biomedical robotics ... Professor

name: Kimberley Hambuchen
title: Human Robotic Systems Deputy Project Manager

name: Sanja Fidler
title: Assistant Professor / Director of AI at NVIDIA

name: Vuyo Makhuvha
title: Head of Strategy and Growth
bio: Makhuvha is a potent mix of maths, entrepreneurship and business skills from McKinsey, and a role leading growth at a fast growing robotics company in Asia. There's no limit to what South African Makhuvha can tackle next.

name: Beatriz Leon
title: Head of Software
bio: Beatriz Leon is Head of Software for Shadow Robot Company, the world leading manufacturer of robot hands. She has many years of experience across the robotics industry and a PhD in advanced computer systems. She is based in Bogota Colombia.

name: Henny Admoni
title: Assistant Professor in the Robotics Institute
bio: Admoni studies how to develop intelligent robots that can assist and collaborate with humans on complex tasks like preparing a meal. She is most interested in how natural human communication can be used to improve human-robot interactions.

name: Hadas Kress-Gazit
title: Associate Professor
organization: Sibley School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, and ICRA2022 Program Chair

name: Xiaorui Zhu
title: Associate Professor | Chair Women in Engineering IEEE RAS

name: Radhika Nagpal
title: Fred Kavli Professor of Computer Science
organization: Wyss Institute - Harvard Harvard | Root Robotics

name: Teresa Vidal Calleja
title: Research Director at Robotics Institute
bio: Teresa Vidal Calleja is a Research Director and Associate Professor at the University of Technology Sydney. Calleja is a robotics expert, who currently has an ARC Discovery grant to work on sensors for the next generation of infrastructure robotics.

name: Maria Pia Fanti
title: Full Professor, Head of Laboratory for Control and Automation
bio: IEEE Fellow and extensive author, Fanti is an Italian control theorist known for her research that includes discrete event dynamic systems, Petri nets, consensus, fault detection and isolation, agile manufacturing, and road traffic control.

name: Laura Margheri
title: Programme Manager and Knowledge Transfer Fellow at Aerial Robotics Lab

name: Ana Paiva
title: Full Professor at IST and Group Leader at INESC-ID
bio: Ana Paiva is a Full Professor in the Dept of Computer Science and Eng, at the University of Lisbon and coordinator of GAIPS “Intelligent and Social Agents Group” at INESC-ID. Paiva is the Katherine Hampson Bessell Fellow at Radcliffe Institute.

name: Amy Loutfi
title: Professor at the AASS Research Center, Department of Science and Technology

name: Marta Palau Franco
title: Programme Officer
bio: Marta Palau Franco is a Programme Officer at the European Commission. She earned her MS in Marine Sciences from the University of Barcelona. Franco was previously Project Officer at euRobotics aisbl. She values the teamwork in robotics development.

name: Nora Ayanian
title: Gabilan Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Director of the ACT lab at USC

name: Joy Buolamwini
title: Poet of Code
organization: Founder of Algorithmic Justice  League and Graduate Researcher at MIT Media Lab
bio: Rhodes Scholar and Fulbright fellow, Buolamwini uses art and research to illuminate the social implications of artificial intelligence. The film Coded Bias highlights the personal and social implications of bias in autonomous systems.

name: Missy Cummings
title: Professor prev Associate Professor of Aeronautics and Astronautics and Engineering Systems |Director, Humans and Automation Laboratory

name: Ginger Schmidt
title: Builder and Team Lead for Season 11 Battlebots Champion
bio: Ginger Schmidt is a Mechanical Engineering and Physics Ph.D. student at MIT, who served as Cocaptain of her team and won the Battlebots title in 2021. Schmidt is also a Graduate Student Researcher at Harvard Medical School and Massachusetts General.

name: Marina Bill
title: President
bio: Marina Bill is President of the International Federation of Robotics, Vice President at ABB Robotics and President of the European AI, Data & Robotics Partnership, which is directing 2.6 Billion euros towards value driven, trustworthy robotics and AI.

name: Jacki Morie
title: Senior Adviser
bio: Widely known as a pioneer in immersive VR environment creation & production, with a focus on evoking meaningful experiences, Morie invented a scent delivery collar an Infrasonic floor. She is now working with sophisticated robotic interactions.

name: Elena Garcia Armada
title: Co-Founder at Marsi Bionics. Senior Researcher at Centre for Automation and Robotics
organization: Marsi Bionics, Spanish National Research Council  & Senior Researcher at Centre for Automation and Robotics

name: Mary-Anne Williams
title: Associate Dean Faculty of Engineering and Information Technology | Director, Innovation and Enterprise Research Lab

name: Maja Mataric
title: Professor and Chan Soon-Shiong Chair in Computer Science, Neuroscience, and Pediatrics | Director, Center for Robotics and Embedded Systems (CRES) | Director of the Interaction Lab ... Founder of Embodied Inc

name: Ruchi Saxena
title: Founder of Caerobotics
bio: Caerobotics is using drones to enable the last-mile ecosystem for delivery, data and mobility, including vaccine delivery in India. Saxena has nearly two decades of developing and integrating healthcare technologies for public health and safety.

name: Maria Bualat
title: Group Lead
organization: Intelligent Robotics Group NASA Ames Research
bio: Maria Bualat is the Group Lead for the Intelligent Robotics Group at NASA Ames Research Center, where she develops robotics systems for space exploration. Her projects include Astrobees, the Mars program's ARC Rover Testbed and Surface Telerobotics.

name: Leah Curry
title: President
bio: Leah Curry is President of one of Toyota's largest US plants, responsible for over 450,000 vehicles/yr and 10,000 team members. Her background is in industrial engineering, and she can see the value that AI and robotics will bring to her workforce.

name: Gudrun Litzenburger
title: General Secretary and Director of Statistics
Robotics Engineer and Founder
bio: Eneni Abban is a Robotics Engineer, STEM Communicator, Founder of Anime and Chill and Women's Engineering Society Winner 22/23. She founded The Techover to empower other women, sharing her tech journey and resources.
name: Eneni Abban

title: Permanent Researcher
bio: Simona Aracri combines engineering and oceanography to develop innovative technology for better understanding ocean processes and tackling climate change. She combines using sensors, data policy and soft robotics in Arctic and Antarctic expeditions.
name: Simona Aracri

title: Co-Founder and Lead Robotics Engineer
bio: Diana Baicu drives technological advancement through her creations. Matt, the ultimate device testing robot is in use on three continents, in multiple industries. Adapta helps people by bringing efficiency to everyday monotonous tasks.
name: Diana Baicu

title: Professor of Computer Science at Heriot-Watt University
organization: Lead for National Robotarium HRI, Health and Assistive Living at The National Robotarium
bio: Lynne Baillie is a Human-Computer & Human-Robot Interaction expert with 100+ peer-reviewed papers and 15+ years of experience in user-centered design and research management, gaining prestigious research grants for HRI and multimodal interaction.
name: Lynne  Baillie

title: Native American Inventor
bio: Danielle Boyer is an Ojibwe robotics inventor, advocate for youth in STEM, and founder of The STEAM Connection. She's changing lives through innovative education and language revitalization.
name: Danielle Boyer

title: Founder
bio: After working as a space robotics engineer, Grace Brown, Mechatronics grad from Melbourne, co-founded a humanoid companion robotics company Andromeda Robotics. She is also a Vogue Codes Future Innovator Winner 2021.
name: Grace Brown

title: Head of the Global Autonomous Technology Group
bio: With a career spanning over 20 years at Daimler, Joanna Buttler has held many positions including program director for autonomous-ready Freightliner Cascadia. She is dedicated to ensuring safety in autonomous technology for the trucking industry.
name: Joanna Buttler

title: Associate Professor
bio: Jen Jen Chung researches perception, planning and learning for robotic mobile manipulation, algorithms for robot navigation through human crowds, informative path planning and adaptive sampling. She is an RSS 2023 Pioneer.
name: Jen Jen Chung

title: Co-founder
bio: Nancy Cornelius, Boston Dynamics co-founder and its first employee, held various roles including CFO and VP of Engineering during her 21-year tenure. She retired in 2013 upon Google's acquisition.
name: Nancy Cornelius

title: Technology Lead - Mobile Robotics
bio: Dipshikha Das, a leading robotics engineer in India, excels in navigation and software development at Addverb. Her expertise and mentoring have been instrumental in advancing the field, and she now leads a team developing top-tier autonomy software.
name: Dipshikha Das

title: Sr. Manager Global Channel - New Product Introductions
bio: Patricia de Boer leads NVIDIA's global automotive ecosystem for autonomous driving R&D and Automotive AI with 20+ years of experience in AI, IoT, and disruptive innovation. She holds an Electrical Engineering degree and a corporate MBA.
name: Patricia de Boer

title: Director of Business Development
bio: As well as developing use cases for collaborative robotics at Alisys, Jorgina Díaz Torres, is the President of HispaRob, the Spanish robotics industry forum, supporting research, conferences, business development and the promotion of robotics.
name: Jorgina Díaz Torres

title: Analyst, Ecosystem
bio: Oyinmiebi Elena Ebikefe is a robotics and AI engineer from Nigeria. She holds a first-class honours degree in electrical and electronics engineering, which led her to explore industrial automation, becoming hooked on robotics and AI.
name: Oyinmiebi Elena Ebikefe

title: Senior Staff Research Scientist
bio: Aleksandra Faust is a globally recognized expert in robotics and AutoML, focusing on autonomy, sequential decision making and deep reinforcement learning. Her research is centered around safe and scalable autonomous systems for social good.
name: Aleksandra Faust

title: Chief Research Scientist
bio: Bronwyn Fox, a pioneer in 3D-printing carbon fiber composites, has won many awards both for her research and her science leadership creating multimillion dollar partnerships, driving innovation in manufacturing, advanced materials and robotics.
name: Bronwyn Fox

title: Business Development and Communications Specialist
bio: Stephanie Garcia has played a key role in creating the San Antonio Robotics Cluster, SATX Robotix, creating awareness of the economic opportunities with the emerging robotics industry. She is recognized on the Top 35 Latinas in Tech list.
name: Stephanie Garcia

title: Technology Manager
bio: Gurpreet Ghataore, a Chartered Engineer and Tech Manager at MTC, leads automation, mechatronics and electronics manufacturing product development. She's an award-winning advocate for automation accessibility and diversity in STEM.
name: Gurpreet Ghataore

title: Innovation/RI2Ve Leader@Center for Innovation Digital Technologies CIDiTec
bio: Paloma González Robles, a Mechatronics professor, leads many projects including one aiming to create a versatile space vehicle for moon missions out of a donated car, incorporating sensor tech, AI, machine learning, and autonomy.
name: Paloma González

title: Assistant Professor in Electrical and Computer Engineering
bio: Melissa Greef specializes in aerial robots, vision-based navigation, and safe learning-based control at the Robora Lab. She is also a member of Ingenuity Labs Robotics Institute, the Vector Institute for AI and a Woman Grandmaster in chess.
name: Melissa Greeff

title: Technical Manager, Project Lead and Robotics Engineer
bio: Florencia Grosso developed a neural network-based brain-computer Interface to aid paralyzed patients for her Master's thesis at the University of Buenos Aires. She started as an electronics engineer but has found her passion in building with code.
name: Florencia Grosso

title: Assistant Professor in Cyber-physical Systems
bio: Didem Gürdür Broo’s research interests are interoperability, sustainability, complexity, data science, AI, and knowledge discovery within cyber-physical systems. She aims to blend systems thinking, design thinking, and future studies.
name: Didem Gürdür Broo

title: Assistant Professor in Mechanical Engineering
bio: Amy Kyungwon Han's research focuses on developing robotic systems, actuators, sensors, and mechanisms that are applicable to grasping and the medical field. She works in the HERO Healthcare Robotics Lab.
name: Amy Kyungwon Han

title: Assistant Professor at Jacobs School of Engineering
bio: Sylvia Herbert received the ONR Young Investigator Program Award in 2022 for her work in constructing and adapting control barrier functions for guaranteed safe control of autonomous systems. She leads the Safe and Autonomous Systems Lab at UCSD.
name: Sylvia Herbert

title: Pinciple Investigator at COHUBICOL
bio: Mirielle Hildebrandt is a lawyer, philosopher and legal scholar laying the foundations for computational law, assessing the fundamental rights impact of autonomous systems in society, and developing the legal protection by design strategy.
name: Mireille  Hildebrandt

title: Tenure Track Assistant Professor
organization: Computational Robot Design & Fabrication Lab, EPFL
bio: Josie Hughes works in bioinspired robotics, exploring applications for agri-food, human collaboration, robot scientists and also environmental monitoring, developing new methods for designing robotics technologies.
name: Josie Hughes

title: Professor & Visiting Researcher at Google (IEEE Fellow)
bio: Jana Košecká researches the acquisition of static, dynamic, and semantic models of environments by means of visual sensing, object recognition, scene parsing, and human-robot interaction. She is IEEE Fellow and Visiting Researcher at Google.
name: Jana Košecká

title: Director
organization: The Robotics, Automation, and Dance (RAD) Lab
bio: Amy LaViers works at the intersection of dance and robotics, bridging traditional engineering training, kinesthetic learning, and principles of choreography. Her book Making Meaning with Machines is published by MIT Press in October.
name: Amy La Viers

title: Wyss Professor of Biologically Inspired Engineering
bio: Jennifer has made pioneering contributions to the programmable assembly of soft functional, structural, and biological materials, with 30+ patents plus the world's first 3-D printer capable of spitting out fully functional electronics.
name: Jennifer Lewis

title: Professor of Robopsychology
bio: Martina Mara studies human-robot relationships and is a member of the Austrian Council for Robotics. As well as speaking publicly about the impacts of robots in society, she is also an advocate for more women in robotics, not more female robots.
name: Martina Mara

title: Associate Director
organization: National Engineering Policy Centre at the Royal Academy of Engineering
bio: Natasha McCarthy has years of experience leading national policy, working across engineering to deliver evidence-based policy advice, and to ensure that engineering serves society, which is critical to the emergence of autonomous systems.
name: Natasha McCarthy

title: Co-Founder
bio: Annette McClelland has bootstrapped Tekuma from a university idea into a company changing the way humans interact with drone technology via their revolutionary, intuitive controller.﻿
name: Annette McClelland

title: Space Systems Director
bio: After 20+ yrs as a NASA engineer and project manager, Dawn McIntosh is now lead of space systems at Fugro, working on Australia's lunar rover in partnership with NASA as part of the Trailblazer Moon to Mars Mission, and assisting the Artemis Mission.
name: Dawn McIntosh

title: Assistant Professor, Computer Science
bio: Reuth Mirsky's research involves methods like parsing, planning, knowledge-based diagnosis, and reinforcement learning. She works on applications in multi-agent systems with long term goal of constructing a guide robot for visually impaired people.
name: Reuth Mirsky

title: Associate Professor in Assistive Robotics
bio: Marcela Múnera graduated as a Bioengineer from Universidad de Antioquia in Colombia before completing her studies in Europe and joining Bristol Robotics Lab to work on human factors in experimental robotics systems and biomechanics.
name: Marcela Múnera

title: Department Chair, Mechanical Engineering
bio: Marcia O'Malley researches haptics and the design and control of wearable robotic devices for training and rehabilitation. She is Editor-in-Chief of ICRA Editorial Board and Associate Editor-in Chief for Transactions on Haptics.
name: Marcia  O'Malley

title: Principal Scientist
bio: Anna's areas of expertise are in Computer Vision, Artificial Intelligence, and Robotics. Currently building robots at Amazon, she has developed new efficient algorithms for autonomous vehicles, mobile manipulation, and tactile object localization.
name: Anna Petrovskaya

title: Director, Institute of Automation
bio: Hong Qiao is an internationally-recognized and highly-cited pioneer researcher in high-precision robotic manipulation and biologically-inspired robotic cognition and manipulation.
name: Hong Qiao

title: Co-Founder and CTO
bio: After holding various robotics research and software engineer roles, Tanya Raghuvanshi co-founded Peer Robotics, on a mission to make industrial robots more collaborative and easier to operate and reprogram.
name: Tanya Raghuvanshi

title: Professor of Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Design
bio: Tahira Reid Smith's research involves the quantification and integration of human-centered considerations in engineering systems. Her work has been funded by the NSF, Procter & Gamble, and the Air Force Office of Scientific Research.
name: Tahira Reid Smith

title: Head of Journal Publishing and Open Science
bio: As well as heading Open Science at the word's leading publisher of Open Access books and journals, Natalia Reinic Babic is also Managing Editor of the International Journal of Advanced Robotics Systems.
name: Natalia Reinic Babic

title: General Manager
bio: Kiki Ren is an experienced robotics manager, first with HIK Robotics and now with VisionNav Japan, a global supplier of autonomous industrial vehicles and intralogistics automation solutions.
name: Kiki Ren

title: Managing Director
bio: Eugénie Rives leverages her deep expertise in robotics, AI, and other emerging technologies to incubate and derisk breakthrough technologies across a diverse range of fields at X, the moonshot factory, solving some of the world’s biggest challenges.
name: Eugénie Rives

title: Board Member and Investor
bio: Whitney Rockley is co-founder of a venture capital firm that invests exclusively in Industrial internet of Things companies like Clearpath Robotics, where she is currently a Board Member.
name: Whitney Rockley

title: Host
bio: A neuroscientist by education but an engineer at heart, Fran uses her knowledge to entertain and excite audiences of stage and screen, including four recent seasons of ABB's The Robot Podcast.
name: Fran Scott

title: Assistant Professor
bio: Yu Jun Tan engineers smart materials for biorobots. She has received the MIT Technology Review Innovators Under 35 (TR35) Asia Pacific, MRS Postdoctoral Award 2021, and Best Paper Award & Best Poster awards in renowned international conferences.
name: Yu Jun Tan

title: Robotics Software Developer
bio: Belén Torres is a robotics software developer, and data science teacher. She also teaches robotics at high schools where she introduces girls to science and technology with a focus on art, gaming, and social impact.
name: Belén Torres

title: Associate Professor and Canada Research Chair in Wearable Mechatronics
bio: Ana Luisa Trejos has worked in research for wearable robotics for rehabilitation and motion assistance for over 20 years and is currently Canada Research Chair in Wearable Mechatronics, working on non intrusive robotics solutions for everyday life.
name: Ana Luisa Trejos

title: Chief Engineer Perseverance Robotic Operations, Deputy Manager Mobility & Robotic Systems Section
bio: Vandi Verma has been engaged in robotic operations on Mars since 2008 working with rovers Spirit, Opportunity, Curiosity, and Perseverance, and Ingenuity helicopter. She leads about 170 JPL roboticists developing future mission technology.
name: Vandi Verma

title: Director of Customer Success & Remote Operations
bio: Awarded a Future Leader of Manufacturing by the Society of Manufacturing Engineers, Amanda Vern is in charge of remote operations and customer success for Phantom Autos, providing an autonomous logistics fleet.
name: Amanda Vernaglia

title: Co-Founder
bio: Defy-Hi Robotics is a portable roof-mounted building envelope inspection robot. As well as running her own companies and working with global brands, Widin is the author of "Catapult: a woman's guide to building a 7-figure business".
name: Abbie Widin

title: Assistant Professor
bio: Maria Yablonina is an architect, researcher, and artist in computational design and digital fabrication. Her work combines architecture and robotics, producing spaces and robotic systems that can construct themselves and change in real-time.
name: Maria Yablonina

title: Tenure-track Assistant Research Professor and Deputy Director of Hawai’i Space Grant Consortium
bio: Frances Zhu was a NASA Space Technology Research Fellow from 2014 to 2019. Her research interests include flux pinned interface applications, spacecraft system architectures, robot dynamics, estimation, and controls, ML and space robotics.
name: Frances Zhu
